intro: Gonolobus purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that open in the morning. The plant typically grows as a vine, with heart-shaped leaves and produces small, green berries that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and rainforests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
